author: NielsJ
post_text: April 23, 2019 at 5:28 PM#1I have seen this work but can't seem to get the syntax correct trying to create a macro that will select the next executor I touch and goto a specific cue in the stack.

posts.author: NielsJ
posts.post_text: April 23, 2019 at 5:28 PM#1I have seen this work but can't seem to get the syntax correct trying to create a macro that will select the next executor I touch and goto a specific cue in the stack.

posts.author: Moe696
posts.post_text: April 23, 2019 at 10:49 PM#2You could do something like this:CodeSetUserVar §gotocue=("Enter Cue Number")Select @Goto Cue §gotocueOr without selecting the executor:CodeSetUserVar §gotocue=("Enter Cue Number")Goto Cue §gotocue @

posts.author: Duplicate bentoylight
posts.post_text: April 25, 2019 at 2:22 PM#4HiYou can do this with buttons :[GOTO] # [exec button] (where # is cue number)It's faster than a macro.

title: Select executor goto cue
